name: Arini
headline: AI receptionist for dentists
description:
Arini is the AI receptionist for dentists that answers phone calls, and schedules appointments. Most dental appointments are scheduled over the phone by overworked receptionists who put patients on hold and miss a third of incoming calls. This costs clinics a 15% loss in revenue.

Private equity investment fueled large dental groups to acquire thousands of clinics in the past few years. We are selling to these groups, since their clinics have a standardized tech stack. They’re also growing really fast - in just two years they will make up 40% of the US dental market.

Dental is just the beginning.
tags: industry:artificial-intelligence; industry:health-tech; industry:dental; industry:call-center; industry:ai; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Abdul Jamjoom, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder at Arini. Previously, I was as an early engineer at Threads (enterprise communication) where I focused on search and AI products. Before that, I received my Bachelors in Computer Science from Harvard in 2019.

founders.name: Rami Rustom, Founder
founders.description: Building AI receptionists for dentists at Arini. Previously Eng + AI @ Threads. MIT CS 2021.

Trusted by hundreds of DSOs, Dental Groups, and Solo Practices across the US and Canada

Hi, Sophie from Arini Dental. How may I help you?
Hey, one of my teeth has been really hurting me for a few days and I wanted to come in and maybe get it checked.
I'm sorry to hear that. Let's get you in for an emergency appointment. Will this be your first visit with us?
Yes.
All right. Let me check our schedule for you. The earliest we can see you is today at 4:30 in the evening. Does that work for you?
Yeah, that works.
Great, I have you down for today at 4:30 in the evening. Can I have your first name?
Oh by the way, I have Medicaid. You take Medicaid, right?
We actually don't accept Medicaid, but we do have a new patient emergency special for $49. Would you like to take advantage of it?
Ok.
Great. What's your first name and spelling?
first name? Robert, last name Alexander.
Thanks. What's your date of birth?
Actually, wait, do you have anything tomorrow? I can't come in today?
Sure thing. We have an opening tomorrow at 10 in the morning. Does that work for you?
Yeah, let's do that. And, do you have parking?
Yes, we have a parking lot right in front of our office.
Your appointment is confirmed for tomorrow at 10 in the morning.
What's your date of birth?
July 14, 98.
Is the number you're calling from the best number to reach you at.
Yes
Great. After this call, you'll get a text with your appointment details. Is there anything else I can assist you with today?
Great. After this call, you'll get a text with your appointment details. Is there anything else I can assist you with today?
No, that's it. Thank you.
Thank you for calling. Have a wonderful day.

FAQS
## Answers to some frequently asked questions.
How does Arini's implementation process work?
Integrate: We meet with your IT to integrate to your practice management software, which allows us to manage your schedule.‍Teach: An Arini implementation Engineer onboards your practice by customizing your scheduling rules, verbiage, call flow, and more.‍Test: You test your custom instance and make edits as you wish.‍Go live: We start taking real patients calls, monitor your calls, and make sure you have a smooth transition!
Is Arini compatible with my practice management software and phone system?
Yes, Arini seamlessly integrates with the vast majority of dental practice management software and phone providers. Our practices use OpenDental, EagleSoft, Denticon, and many more. In terms of phone providers, we have practices using Weave, Mango, GoTo, Jive, RevenueWealth PBX, Telco and more.
How secure is Arini's technology?
At Arini, we prioritize data security and privacy. Our system is 100% HIPAA compliant and we follow the principle of least privilege and strict role-based permissions for data access. We use strong encryption protocols for data transmission and have a [Trust Center](https://www.arini.ai/<https:/arini.secureframetrust.com/>) that continuously monitors our compliance. Our board of technical advisors took companies from inception to IPO in the dental industry. 
## Trusted by these industry leaders and many more.

Hey, one of my teeth has been really hurting me for a few days and I wanted to come in and maybe get it checked.
I'm sorry to hear that. Let's get you in for an emergency appointment. Will this be your first visit with us?

Ok.

FAQS
## Answers to some frequently asked questions.
How does Arini's implementation process work?
Integrate: We meet with your IT to integrate to your practice management software, which allows us to manage your schedule.‍Teach: An Arini implementation Engineer onboards your practice by customizing your scheduling rules, verbiage, call flow, and more.‍Test: You test your custom instance and make edits as you wish.‍Go live: We start taking real patients calls, monitor your calls, and make sure you have a smooth transition!
Is Arini compatible with my practice management software and phone system?
Yes, Arini seamlessly integrates with the vast majority of dental practice management software and phone providers. Our practices use OpenDental, EagleSoft, Denticon, and many more. In terms of phone providers, we have practices using Weave, Mango, GoTo, Jive, RevenueWealth PBX, Telco and more.
How secure is Arini's technology?
At Arini, we prioritize data security and privacy. Our system is 100% HIPAA compliant and we follow the principle of least privilege and strict role-based permissions for data access. We use strong encryption protocols for data transmission and have a Trust Center⟨18⟩ that continuously monitors our compliance. Our board of technical advisors took companies from inception to IPO in the dental industry. 
## Trusted by these industry leaders and many more.

generated_description:
Arini is an innovative startup founded in 2024, operating out of San Francisco, and it made its mark as part of the Y Combinator Batch W24. The company’s mission is straightforward: to serve as an AI receptionist specifically tailored for dental practices. As we know, dental clinics often face the challenge of missed calls and overworked human receptionists, leading to a staggering 15% revenue loss. Arini addresses this gap by offering a AI system that answers phone calls and schedules appointments 24/7, ensuring that practices don’t miss out on potential patients.

The landscape of dental care is changing, heavily influenced by the recent surge in private equity investments which have empowered large dental groups to acquire thousands of clinics. This is where Arini’s strategy becomes particularly clever. By targeting these rapidly expanding dental groups that have standardized tech stacks, Arini positions itself perfectly to meet the needs of a growing market that is anticipated to dominate 40% of the U.S. dental market in just two years.

Currently a lean team of two, Arini is already capturing attention with its technology, which has resolved over 10,000 calls daily. The system integrates seamlessly with various existing dental management software, making it a versatile solution for many practices.

Pete Koomen, a partner at the firm, is leading this charge, and the early traction indicates that Arini’s technology not only helps increase revenue but also significantly reduces the need for additional hiring—creating a win-win scenario for dental practices.

Arini's potential is just beginning to be realized, and the roadmap suggests that dental is only the starting point. As they refine their AI capabilities and expand their market presence, we might see applications of their technology branching into other areas of healthcare and customer service. 

If you want to see it in action or learn more, you can check out their website at [Arini.ai](https://www.arini.ai). The landscape of dental reception is set for transformation, and it’s clear that Arini is aiming to lead that charge.
